intro: Gorteria linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf gorteria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Gorteria linearis is appreciated for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
